intro: Ixeridium dentatum f. atropurpureum, commonly known as the purple-leaved form of the common rockrose, is a flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its striking purple foliage and clusters of small, pink to reddish flowers. Native to southern Europe, this plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and full sun. Its ornamental value lies in its vibrant leaf color and compact growth habit. It is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and low maintenance requirements.
